Pikesville 110 Proof Straight Rye Whiskey,"Appearance / Color?
Dry cocoa, charred oak, spice, vanilla cream.
Rich, dry, and savory with plenty of rye spice, orange-blossom honey, fresh clove, anise, and even some autumn fruits.

Long with granola notes.","[[""Darn near perfect. For such a high proof rye, it's so smooth, with the expected rye bite coming at the end. Easy sipper, plan to always have this on my shelf. Price point spot on for this whiskey.""], [""One of my favorite rye's""], ['Love it !!'], ['A fantastic higher proof rye that is full of flavor but the proof doesnt overwhelm'], ['This is my all-time favorite Rye. Smooth on the tongue with a little bite at the end.'], ['Nice sipping Rye with a strong pepper finish. Great on lite ice or as an Manhattan'], ['Color is a reddish copper. Nose starts with a little ethanol, definitely needs a minute to sit and breathe. After allowing it to breathe, a mildly sweet aroma emerges. Notes of cocoa, subtle cherry, and mild spice. First sip packs a bit of a punch from the proof and rye spice; it is a little less sweet than the nose lets on, almost dry. Rye spice and black pepper are the predominate flavors on the palate initially. As acclimation to the proof and rye spice occurs, notes of cream, leather, and just a hint of tobacco finish off the palate. Finish is a long linger of the rye spice, accentuated by the drying of the palate by the high proof. Overall a fantastic example of Rye Whiskey, with a high proof high spice flavor.'], ['My favorite rye whiskey'], ['Smoother than you would think for 110 proof'], ['Fantastic rye. Surprised to see so many calling this spicy, though. For me, despite its proof, this is a sweeter, more cherried rye. Incredibly smooth for 110p.'], ['Spice and sweet in perfect balance. Name a better rye... I dare you!'], ['Sweet and spicy, lots to unpack'], ['This stuff is amazing.  Very smooth for proof.'], ['A perfect rye. Plenty of spice, but also a fair amount of sweetness. Really well balanced and a nice mouthfeel and finish. The high alcohol content doesn’t overpower the complex flavor'], ['Spicy Rye'], ['The perfect rye.'], ['very dry and spicy which is a lot of fun'], ['Spicy...big time.  But balanced and smooth.  Perfect for refined drinking.'], ['Another Heaven Hill masterpiece.  Love it all over again no matter how long it’s been.'], ['Delicious. Pairs perfectly with grilled chicken wings and a smooth cigar'], ['Best rye I’ve had in any price range'], ['A strong body with a sharpness to it that I have come to love of rye. Very impressive drink that challenges much more pricey bottles of rye.'], ['Great all around Rye. 110 proof, but great any way you want to drink it. I take it backpacking (straight), and I like it in my manhattans.'], ['I like drinking ryes and this is a fine one. Maybe quite as good as not as the E.H Taylor rye but a solid expression. If you like Rittenhouse you’ll enjoy this one.']]"
Melted caramel and fire roasted vanilla
Buttery mouthfeel toasted toffee, black pepper and smoked cocoa nibs

Bold and long lasting, a smoldering campfire of American hardwood","[['Smooth for the price. Finish of wood smoke.'], ['This is one of the best I have tried in this price range. Not being a person who can tell all the different flavors involved I can only say what I like. This is a very smooth whiskey and great for sipping neat or over ice.']]"
Orphan Barrel Rhetoric 24 Year Old Bourbon,"Appearance / Color
Aromas of oak and vanilla on the nose, followed by caressing brown sugar, chocolate and leather.
Flavors of orchard fruits, oak, vanilla and anise, with subtle notes of spicy cinnamon and honey shine on the palate.

Warm and sweet finish of nutmeg and caramel.","[['It’s good but Too old.So much wood'], ['Really smooth and sweet. Not too much oak even though 24 years. More of an after dinner drink than a classic bourbon.'], ['For those unaware, this is the fifth iteration of the Orphan Barrel Rhetoric series. As far as we are aware, each whiskey comes from the same provenance, and the different age expressions allow one to travel through the oak maturation process. On to the whiskey:\r\rBefore Water\r\rNose: Candied cherries. Some other dried berries underneath. Blueberry honey. A bit of leather, wafting up from below. As it opens up a bit more, citrus peel. Smells like orange peel to my nose. Vanilla. Lots of vanilla at the end.\r\rPalate: Oak. Lots of oak. Leather/tannins coming through strongly. The dried cherry on the nose gives way to dried cherries on the palate, underneath the oak and leather. Further along, a bit of sourness and bitterness pierces through. Not unpleasant, mind you, but noticable. \r\rAfter Water (1/2 teaspoon):\r\rNose: Less of the candied cherries and dried fruit, more citrus peel. The honey and vanilla come on more strongly. A small hint of the leather from new shoes. \r\rPalate (after 1/2 teaspoon water): Still oak. Still leather. After the water, the oak and leather drown out a lot of the more subtle flavors, which I find unusual, as usually the opposite happens. After a while, the vanilla starts coming through. All in all, a very barrel-influenced bourbon, which is not surprising given its age.\r\rRating: 6 stars. This rating’s wholly a function of Flaviar’s price for this bottle. At around $165, which is what I paid for it, it goes up to an 8. Still, this bottle is not as good as the 23 year. The oak influence is becoming a bit too heavy and is drowning out the high-quality spirit. Still, if you find a good price, worth a buy.'], ['Wonderful bourbon. Leathery with cinnamon and oak. Rich and complex.']]"
Opulent oaky notes with dark berries and molasses.
Complex blend of caramel, dried fruit, and oak, with hints of spice.

Lingering dry finish with sweet fruit and rye spice aftertaste.","[['I love it\rMy new favorite \rSoft\rFill bodied yet youthful and flamboyant'], ['This is the smoothest, most delicious rye I’ve ever tasted.'], ['Super smooth! Easy drinking'], [""One of my favorite Rye's right now""], ['Do not like this at all'], [""I don't really like. The profile is generally sweet, with a really strange butter pecan kind of finish. Very odd and not at all what I hoped for in a rye.""], ['Good nose, dark in color and smooth start to finish. Recommend Hayden Basil Dark Rye.'], ['Rich and sweet, like a dark cake still warm from the oven. The sweetness of the port melds with the spiciness of the rye. The result is pleasant, but just a touch syrupy. Not your everyday rye. I usually pour some when my sweet tooth is wanting some dessert.'], ['Rye on Rye is much better than Double Rye... a Fan of Basil Hayden’s... but not Double Rye'], ['My favorite dark rye.A blend of caramel, dried fruit, and oak, with hints of spice. Lingering dry finish with sweet fruit and rye spice aftertaste'], ['Pleasantly surprised with the taste, smell, and flavor.  Certainly exceeded my expectations and is a great whiskey for a bourbon lover.'], ['This is exceptional stuff. Not quite sure how I feel about wine being added to the whiskey but the flavor is unique and tasty nonetheless'], ['Wow!  This is really good. Added just a splash of water.'], ['Smooth rye with bold caramel tones. Port comes through on the finish.'], ['Nothing special - lacks both the spice of a rye and the depth of a port.'], ['This is a solid rye. Perfect combination of sweet and spicy. Finish errs on the side of smooth with an acceptable initial bite from the spice.'], ['Too heavy for me'], ['smooth, sweet, and delicious'], ['Incredible!  Not too sweet. Hint of cinnamon.'], ['Really really good.  Friendly, fruit and caramel forward nose and the taste explodes on the tongue before giving way to the dryness more often found in wine.  Very very interesting pour.'], ['Insanely good'], [""I don't like how this one starts for me.  Finish is good, but the beginning is just difficult to overcome.""], ['This whiskey would be an easy bottle to finish in one sitting. It’s that smooth. Personally I like whiskeys a little spicier but this is pretty good. One note, it’s so mellow it’s better without ice to water it down.'], ['Love Basil Haden’s but this is too sweet and fruity. Ok for mixing though.'], ['Best whiskey I have ever had.  It is my new #1!'], ['A great after dinner spirit.'], ['Really good. The flavor spiral shows much different than what I tasted. I also drink mine on the rocks with water. Sweet and smooth. Will be ordering a bottle for sure. Probably my top 2 favorites.'], ['Best I have ever tasted'], ['Sweeter whiskey that hides the rye spice. Good as neat or as a mixer'], ['Awesome in old fashioned drinks. Love the spice flavors.'], ['very sweet rye, port really shows in the bottle, good as a mixer for sweet drinks'], ['The predominate flavor is port. Very odd taste.'], ['Loved this rye!  The port definitely smooths out the taste and makes for a great drink neat.'], ['great for old fashioned'], ['Odd flavor profile. Tried it thinking it was port barrel aged and not port infused. Not something I would order again, but may be for you if you like a lot of port and berry.'], ['You first are welcomed by the caramel and floral aromas, but it isn’t strong— just enough to entice you to take a sip. It’s smooth, a good balance of the sweetness from the fruits and berries. As you sit waiting for the leaving flavor, the port wine makes itself known. The spicy part— or lack there of, only exists to tickle your lips and make you want to sip again. Very enjoyable. On second sip you can taste the port taking a bigger stand, and the “spicy” diminishes.'], ['The spice is dominates the flavor profile but is complimented by the fruit and berry immediately following. Certainly not bad, not a favorite though'], ['I’m a big fan of the Beam Distillery’s craft offerings, so I gave this a shot even though I’m not a fan of a Port.  The smoothness helps to make this pleasurable and I notice a great deal of dried fruit.  I’m glad I gave this a try!'], ['Smell:. Stinging oak and burnt-ish Caramel.\rTaste:Caramel, oak and spice forefront, barely a hint of dried fruit.\rFinish:. Dry and lots of that rye spice.\r\rOverall a great rye, with lots of that rye spiciness I love.  On the rocks the heavy oak is diminished and rye spice amplified.'], ['Enjoyed the smell.  Hints of spice and smooth, no strong.  Taste was very satisfying.  Spice, orange and a bit of the Brandy lingers.  Some may not like this depending on your taste preference, but nice for late night drink.'], ['If we’re talking drinkability, this gets a 10. Remarkably smooth, and extremely accessible to the new or experienced whiskey drinker. I just can’t help but feel like I want a little more out of my drink.  After three or four basil Hayden dark ryes, I’m left wanting. Especially for a rye, there is very little complexity or spice.'], ['Smooth finish'], [""Much too sweet up front for my taste, borderline cloying, but has a nice spicy finish that at least makes it drinkable. Still, I find myself wishing it was just the rye without the port. Going to try in a cocktails or two to see how it mixes, but don't think I'd ever get this one again.""], ['Weird after taste mixed with a bad fake syrup flavor makes this the worst Rye I have ever had.'], [""One of the best things I've had. The port does not take a way from the rye flavor, it adds a little sweet and smooth.""], ['Smooth sweet taste. No bitterness.'], ['First time having dark Rye. Very smooth and sweet and this would be very good during winter months to come. I think it is a very nice Port and finish.'], ['Love it for the smoothness, sweet taste and hint of spice. Definitely will have this on hand in the winter/holiday season.'], ['Really smooth. The port is a great addition.'], ['Wonderful sweet rye!'], ['Outstanding drink, on the sweet side but not a problem for me. The problem is I keep drinking it and have a little to much.'], ['First time having a dark rye. Very impressed'], [""I like it!  I find some people are put off by the addition of some Port wine (i.e. it's not just finished in Port barrels), but if you think of it as a bottled cocktail, it's quite nice.""], ['I love the flavor of this the. Has a bit of sweetness that rocked the old fashioned I had. Now I drink it neat. So nice.'], ['As smooth as you would expect for a Basil Hayden but still flavorful. Lots of fruit and a little spice. I don’t keep Basil Hayden on my shelf but this rye will do.'], ['My favorite right now. Smooth, sweetness of a Tawny Port with a spicy rye finish. Smoke with a Blondie for a great pairing'], ['Love it even more'], ['I love what the port does for this whiskey.'], ['Good but to hot'], ['Super solid sipper.  Awesome blend and def a go to for my shelf now!'], ['It is my new favorite whiskey!!'], ['Great! Smooth on the rocks!'], [""Very interesting! So I smell the port and caramel notes. Goes down smooth but definitely tastes like drinking a bottle of port with a touch of rye whisky added. Not what you'd expect from a Canadian whisky, but extremely smooth and worth the price.""], ['This is a good deal.  Nice with a few rocks, or better yet in a Manhattan!'], [""Incredibly unique, but the Port overpowers any rye spiciness. I'd rather drink a rye or a port.""], ['A sweet easy drinking liquor that still has a nice spicy rye kick. I’d advise people new to rye start with this. It’s sweet but still high quality that won’t disappoint the rye initiated.'], ['very nice'], ['Definitely unique.  The Rye Spice and the port hit at the same time.'], ['Delicious and has many flavors to balance on the tongue. May be a bit on the sweet side for those who like a little bite on the tongue or enjoy the Rye side of whiskey. I treat it like desert and only have one.'], ['One of my favorite one-off ryes. The port blend finish on this is amazing. It pairs will with steak and chocolate. What more could you ask for?'], ['Really not that spicy. The sweetness of the caramel and berry flavors really come through. Delicious rye!'], ['As a rye blended with port, expected a more flavorful taste. It has a nice smooth feel to it, although taste to me with port sweetness is closer to a highly refined Tennessee whiskey. The Two by Two likely more in line with my taste.'], ['This might be my favorite rye out there right now. This rye is as complex and sweet. The port barrels truly impart something special into this fine whiskey.'], [""Really liked this one.  Very smooth and rich.  Didn't taste much like rye, but was still very good.""], [""I'm not a rye lover - or heck, not even much of  a whiskey drinker.  At least I wasn't until this Basil Hayden Dark Rye.  This port-finished dark rye is amazing.  If I could find it, I'd buy 10 cases of it right now. Seriously, it really is that good.""], ['Nose is oak and berries the port comes through here. Pretty smooth not typical rye spice more of a citrus spice. The finish is All port sweet and fruity. Not going in my regular rotation will reserve for cocktails.'], ['Smooth with notes of dried fruit at the end. Beautiful, rich amber color.'], ['Taste amazing'], ['Smooth and delicious, unique to any other rye I’ve had but will be one I definitely keep in stock.'], ['Smooth and Delicious!!!!'], ['Smooth! I’ll be stocking this one in the home bar. Very easy to drink, sweet to the nose.'], [""I just love this dark rye blend and I'm not normally a big dark rye guy. It's a very smooth drink and has become one of my favorite nightcaps. The only problem I have with this bottle is that I can't find another anywhere near me!""], ['Strong port flavor. Great with dessert.']]"
William Cadenhead 13 Year Old Single Malt Irish Whiskey,,[]
J.B.A. Whisky Byron The Best Barmen's Choice,,[]
Tullamore D.E.W. Tullamore Dew 12 Year Old,"Appearance / Color

column2: Yellow Gold
Sweetened fruits, lemons and oranges with a sprinkle of brown sugar.
Vanilla and Sherry drenched fruit, creamy, buttery texture.

Caramel and ripe lemons.","[['Love it! Smooth.'], ['Great for the price.'], ['Definitely up there as far as Irish goes.  The extra couple of years make a big difference.  Not quite a Redbreast 12, but delicious non the less.'], ['Like it. Smooth. Not to much heat. Not smoky'], ['This should 100% be on your home bar if you want any semblance of a well stocked bar. Quintessential Irish whisky!'], ['Not really liking this one'], ['Nothing distinctive'], ['Smooth & rich on the tongue. As it should be. Delicious.'], [""Smooth as a baby's arse.""], ['Love the finish  and flavor. I’ve visited the distillery in Ireland.'], ['Tullemore Dew is my favorite whiskey of all time, very smooth, best Irish Whiskey I know of'], ['Smoothest Whisky I’ve ever tasted. My go to sipping drink'], ['Smooth as it gets.'], ['Pleasing sweet, smooth, with just a nice saturating burn that is not overdone. Very enjoyable neat.'], ['Wow...'], ['Smooth'], ['For a 12-year it is VERY smooth.  Clean taste.'], ['Okay my first 10 star, this is probably the most complex Irish Whiskey I have had to date.  The nose is a pleasant sweet smell of figs, and some oak undertones with no serious burn. The initial taste is the same with some brown sugar, and something of a grain flavor (maybe bread or donut).  The finish is very satisfying for a 40 ABV liquor, and is pleasant.  Actually worth every penny and is going to be rotating often on my liquor cabinet.'], ['This is good, but I prefer the non-Special Reserve.  Not much of a fan of ports and wine.'], ['Very smooth with a soft finish. This is my new favorite. Love it!'], ['Just added this one to my bar. Have had two glasses neat. Very good.'], ['Richtig sch?ner holziger Geschmack, so muss Whiskey schmecken01/19 Oberndorf'], ['Slightly sweet, spicy and with a bite. Was a recommendation from an Irish bar tender in NYC who told me that this was the drink that people had in Ireland and not Jameson.'], ['Great tasting and smooth. Will get again.'], ['It’s real smooth.'], ['This bottle makes all my scotch fiend friends shut up.'], ['Classic & easy'], ['Traditional Irish Whiskey, smooth with a bit of a spice to it. Great neat.'], ['Light vanilla and fruit, pleasant aftertaste'], ['Said it and then shots'], [""Was lucky enough to sample this on St. Patrick's Day 2018. Super smooth.""], ['Great breakfast beverage with a full Irish breakfast.'], ['there is a sweetness to this one, oh my, such beautiful and wonderful flavor.'], ['Smooth, hint of sweetness. Pleasant and easy to drink.'], ['I fell in love with the entire Tullamore D.E.W. line on a trip to Ireland last year. They are a must have in any home bar.'], ['Mild sweet but a rough ending'], ['Surprisingly good!  Smooth, not too sweet.'], ['Smooth and easy drinking.'], ['My favorite to go “just a shot” drink. Very smooth.'], ['Awesome taste. Very smooth and gentle. A must have in any bar.'], ['My go-to for Irish whiskey'], ['All ""DEW"" \'s are very smooth and tasty.  A note of peat with the oak.'], ['2nd best on my shelf'], ['The fucking shit'], ['Very smooth - my favorite go to.'], ['Sweet fruit flavor and great repeat to return to over and again'], [""It's bold and refreshing nice to sip and relax""], ['My daily drinker, an absolutely delicious Irish Whiskey at a very reasonable price.'], ['Slightly spicy short finish, no depth in taste, lost of oaky aroma, sharp on the pallet'], ['Great wee whiskey at a very reasonable cost'], ['Goooood!'], ['The best of the TD range - for now!'], ['One of the cheaper Irish whiskeys, it tastes watery and is not very smooth.']]"

column1: Various Vault Selection XXV. The Far East Connection,,[]
Notes of buttered corn, toasted oak and maple sugar.
Hints of oak and sap mingle with a touch of corn, a little spice.
Clean, with a hint of oak.",[]
Chichibu 2010 Ichiro's Malt for Isetan Cask No. 755,,[]
Schenley O.F.C. 6 Year Old Canadian Whisky 1952,,[]
Barrell Bourbon Barrel Bourbon Beast Masters Private Cask,"Appearance / Color
Roasted pralines and caramel with baking spices
Rich and creamy with butter-toffee and spice cake
Various Vault Selection XIX. The might of Japan,,[]
Dense note of maple and pipe tobacco
Thick and flavorful with butterscotch, cherry, and a classic Rye kick of raw baking spices

Long, warm, and spicy","[['starts with a honey vanilla flavor ends with a spicy flavoring'], ['Love this to death. I enjoy it over ice.'], ['Great Rye for the price value, helps make a great Manhattan'], ['Sweeter than I expected but still the nice rye bite. One of the impulse buys I definitely do not regret!'], ['Really tasty rye at a nice price.'], [""Definitely worth the purchase. One of the better whiskeys I've bought at this price point. Enough so that I bought a second bottle. I found it to be sweet on the tongue with a spicy finish.""], ['Sweet smooth finish.'], ['Smooth, light, worth the price.'], [""Hands down my go to Whiskey for the dollar. It's smooth enough to pair with a meal and is definitely for enjoying neat --""], [""This is not a bad dram, but for me it's a little hot. I had to cut it with some cold water and then the flavors really came out. Not a bad price if you are looking for an everyday sipper.""], ['Beautiful rye to drink neat, rocks or in a Manhattan'], ['Intensely smooth. Hints of caramel aftertaste. Perfect for sipping after dinner.'], ['One of the smoothest whiskeys  if had for the money!'], ['Tastes like rum, apparently on purpose. Waiting for the whiskey I ordered to arrive!'], ['Simple end of the day, or mid-afternoon drink. Recommend with a light cigar, and great for the price. You can tell its a Pendleton, and will probably go with 1910 over the others.'], ['Excellent rye. On the sweet side but still complex. Extremely good for the price.'], ['Smooth, bu a little sweet'], ['Nice mellow taste on the sweeter side that the wife was able to drink neat with me.'], ['Fairly one note to me. Some spice and charcoal. I would prefer it in a mixed drink.'], ['One of my first whisky loves.  Tried for the first time 13 years ago and became part of my home bar ever sense.'], ['One of my favorite Canadians. Bought it on a whim. I’m on my 3rd bottle and consider this one a bar staple.'], ['One of my first whiskey loves.'], ['Perfection'], ['Very good, not as good as the Directors Reserve but still good'], ['So far the best bottle I have purchased from Flaviar. I actually purchased just to have on hand due to the lower price. I am shocked at the fantastic flavor. A pleasure to drink so warm and inviting will purchase again and again. I think this would be wonderful for parties clearly can be passed off as more expensive.'], [""Literally undrinkable to me. Overly sweet caramel taste. Might try it in a Manhattan, but I'm still afraid it will ruin the flavor of cheap vermouth. I've never had a whiskey that I couldn't even choke down, but this is one. Bought it based upon Flaviar ratings - guess I learned a valuable lesson.""], ['It\'s a solid Canadian whiskey, but in the end, sadly uneventful. Don\'t misunderstand; it\'s smooth. And if necessary, it will get you drunk. But don\'t get caught up on the word ""Rye"" on the bottle. Rye must mean something else in Canada... I mean, there\'s a hint of Rye there... right? ... Or do I just want there to be a hint of Rye my Canadian whiskey? If a maple tree falls in a Canadian forest, but no one is around to hear it, does it add Rye to Pendleton?'], [""I'm not big on sweet whiskey or Canadian whiskey, so giving this a 6 is pretty good for me. I like to sip this watered down with some rocks to take an edge off the sweet maple.""], ['Decent'], ['Very good'], ['Smooth but still flavorful.'], ['I ordered this as a gift. Kevin loves this.'], ['I love the 12 year old Pendleton. It is very smooth going down with a sweet finish.'], ['Good, not great.'], ['I have learned I am a rye whisky lover. This one is especially good. It is a darker color and it has a sweet taste at the finish. I just had a shot to try it and later poured some on the rocks. Love it!!'], ['Really good. Smooth, a little sweet and to me, not that spicy.  Originally rated a 9, I’m coming back to make this one a 10!'], ['Sweet finish.'], ['Husband loves all pendleton whiskeyvery smooth to drink.'], ['Sweet, caramel, woody, fire and slight floral finish. Lovely.'], ['I always have a few dozen bottles of this on hand! Absolute Favorite!'], ['Good drink'], ['Smooth as it goes down. Good to have by yourself or to have with friends. Good on hot summer days and nights.  Good for winter nights.'], ['I rarely drink, but I could be an alcoholic with this 1910 Pendleton. Not too expensive, and goes down waaay too easily.'], ['Excellent on the rocks'], ['Awesome whisky!'], ['Delightful. I’m a bourbon drinker, and Stranahan’s has been my favorite. I wanted something different and this delivers. Straight up it’s sweet but not nauseatingly so like a honey whiskey. In an old fashioned the hint of cherry comes out. Awesome. And yes, as an Oregon resident I’m biased!'], ['Has a certain sweetness to it.  Smooth and easy to sip'], ['Amazing rye!'], ['It is extremely smooth and a almost sherry cask flavor. It’s sweeter with out the rye spiciness. Greatfor sipping with a smooth cigar. Great for Manhattans.'], ['This is one of my absolute favorites! Complex with a nice long finish, nothing too harsh... spicy, carmelly and warm. On the sweeter side, but not syrupy. Just delicioso!'], ['Love it!'], ['Great for a ""rough day"" tumbler.'], ['I can taste the maple, butterscotch and cherry, as well as a little bit of spice.'], ['Neat is the only way to enjoy.'], ['Nice whiskey to just sit back and sip. A bit spicy, but overall, great!'], ['Perhaps I may be a tad biased being from Oregon, however, dollar for dollar, this is my absolute favorite Whisky and Spirit. Sippable, mixable and enjoyable year round, I do my best to always have a bottle on hand.'], [""I think this is one of the best Rye Whiskies I've had, my uncle turned me onto it, it's really great neat or with ice. Only problem I have is I wish the bottle lasted longer. Let'er buck, Cowboy""], ['Hands down the best rye whisky I have ever had.  Disappointed that it is hard to get.'], ['This one is pretty good. I prefer it neat. The rye shines through and has a warm finish. I am a fan of the Pendleton brand offerings. All of them I prefer straight up neat.'], ['smooth, drinkable, affordable.'], ['Extremely smooth and a great value!'], ['A sweet and complex rye'], ['A pretty sweet rye without a lot of the typical rye spiciness. Good Caramel notes right off the bat. Amazing bottle.'], [""haven't had it in awhile but always like it when I do""], ['Quite possibly the best Rye I have ever tasted and I have been drinking Rye whiskey for 55 years.']]"

column2: Dark Amber
Spicy with hints of cinnamon, nutmeg and molasses.
Sweet sensations of caramel and vanilla with some creamy undertones dark red fruit flavors in the background.

Rich and full of rye taste that is just everlasting.","[['It is a good, intense, Rye Whiskey that has a spicy birth; while a rich life leads to a long & full death with notes of rye & pepper.'], ['Even my wife liked this one. Nice nose and the forward flavors were distinctive, especially when opened up with dropper of water.'], [""Got this in my tasting box and it was easily my least favorite.  Very strong alcohol smell like crown which I don't like.  First taste was all spice followed by vanilla and a rough burn going down.  Other reviewers are correct that water and ice helps tame the spice and bring out the buttery flavors but it was still not good.  Wouldn't buy at all.""], [""Got this in my sampler. I don't like to complain, but something tasted very off. Huge parsley, gasoline, and other vegetal notes. That can't be right. Would be open trying again, though, if it was one-time issue.""], ['The noise is not pleasant'], ['Super spicy upfront! But a cozy warm blanket with fuzzy socks once you settle in.'], ['Young whiskey. The smell and taste of alcohol is prevalent but not unpleasant. For a 90 proof it’s rather smooth with little bite. The butter and malty profiles are out in front. Oak and fruit appear depending on where the sip falls on your tongue.'], ['This was rough neat, but I added a splash of water and it was very enjoyable. I’d imagine over an ice cube it’d be pretty solid as well.'], ['This is the Uma Thurman of Rye whiskeys. At first, you might think it\'s unattractive. But after your second encounter, you realize this is the rye you\'ve been waiting for your whole life. My first taste left me with a strong, spicy taste that did not mellow. However, on second approach (and after a bit of chilling and a dash of water), the buttery, sweet characteristics came out. I have had the pleasure of enjoying many an outstanding Rye, but this is the ""one that got away"". The small taste that came with my Flaviar box has stayed with me for the past 2 months. I have actively searched for it at every Manhattan liquor store I have shopped at, but like a New York minute, it has eluded me. It is, without a doubt, the most intriguing bottle of rye that I have ever had the pleasure of including in my liquor cabinet. Don\'t be stupid. Buy the freaking bottle.'], ['Good taste and nice finish.   Use a cube of ice with it'], ['i’m not sure what that initial flavor was for some reason I can’t put my finger on it but I am not a fan'], ['Great if you like mixing rubbing alcohol with your whiskey !!'], ['I enjoyed this. At first not so much, as I thought a butter taste came on too strong. After putting it on ice and letting sit for a little while, a sweetness came out and almost reminded me of an oak aged sweet butter cream if that makes any sense. Haha.'], ['Sweet and spicy but not very complex.  Added a couple of drops of water to tame the heat.'], ['Eh, it’s cool what they’re doing but unfortunately it’s not my glass of rye. Nothing in the profile stood out flavor wise. Sorry to say I would not recommend.'], ['Too light.'], ['Sweet and buttery with just enough spice.  Not a great sipper, but I can see it as a good base for a cocktail, lots of different notes going on that could compliment many different types of cocktails.  For the price, though, I wouldn’t make it my first choice.'], ['This is one of my least favorite ryes I have tried. Very heavy on the alcohol. Almost medicinal.'], [""Aroma:. Slightly sweet, Woody, iodine-y.  Taste: malty with a hint of spice.  Alcohol overpowers.  On ice: malty, hint of sweetness.\r\rNot going to be high on my list of ones to buy or drink again.  Won't turn down if handed to me.""], ['Pure alcoholic smell couldn’t get past but had sweet buttery taste with a spiced finish. Too strong of a smell and too sweet for my taste'], [""I feel like I must have gotten a different batch from other reviewers here. I found this terrible, all ethyl at the nose, then thin and rough and quietly chaotic from start to finish. It brings me no pleasure to give such a negative review, and I wish Bender's well, but boy there's not much to like here.""], ['Let it breathe and it will take your breath away'], ['Loved it!! Sweet for a Rye, but so smooth.'], ['Smooth, great buttery and vanilla flavor'], ['Very spicy'], ['Sweet and spicy, but not much else. Maybe walnuts and honey? Smooth, though.'], ['Smooth start with a spicy finish. Really wasn’t expecting that much bite, but I liked it'], ['Smells like paint thinner but has a delicious light body.'], ['Not very smooth and has a rough spicy flavor that just lingers after.  Keep trying new recipes Bender’s this ones not for me'], ['Classic rye but nothing special.  Very little nose, almost undetectable.'], ['Very good. You get apple in the nose. Apple and char on the palate. Short finish.'], ['All I really tasted was spice and vanilla. Was my least favorite of the 3 samples in the 2nd Generation Rye sampler.'], ['Wow! Absolutely delicious. Undeniable caramel br?l?e flavors. This is a new Flaviorite!'], ['Definitely perfect for an old fashioned or manhattan. I would most likely enjoy it neat for desert after a meal.'], ['A little spicy. Quite sweet. Would balance with some bitters in an OF.'], ['LOVED this. Almost like a hot buttered rum — dessert-like for sure. Smooth and warm.'], [""Close but not cigar! The nose made me think I was about to sample a liqueur or something super sweet. As pleasant and the dominate notes are the finish ruins it for me. It's just too subtle. The sweetness has nothing to compliment it. Needs more character.""], ['Light but flavorful!'], ['Very subtle and smooth. Not a lot of character.'], ['Fruity, smooth late heat'], ['Smooth and slightly sweet'], ['Beautiful Creamy Vanilla Nose!! Vanilla Creamy Body. With Rye and Cinnamon Lingering at the end. This one is the best of the Tasting Set!!'], ['Was very pleasant beginng,with a mild after taste of oak. Very drinkable']]"

column1: Kavalan Vault Selection XIV. Kavalan Trio,,[]
Soft and nutty with charred oak
Full bodied with warm walnuts and cashews over a barely base, but enough cinnamon-vanilla to please

Long, warm, and spicy","[['Not your normal whiskey.'], ['While it may be a bit spicy for some, I found it enjoyable with Club Soda but for a real treat mix with a splash of ginger ale. Then it sings.'], ['A very pleasant surprise. Slight Quinoa taste, smooth with a nice mouth feel.'], [""This whiskey isn't for everyone but I quite enjoy it for sipping even though it says it's made for mixing.""], ['A little too much of a dry spiciness for me. It therefore comes across hot and bitter.'], [""Gritty flavor. Tried to like it, but couldn't get over the overbearing earthy flavor.""], [""Deep strong flavors. Spicy yet complex and smoky. Very interesting flavors. I'm a fan""], ['Excellent taste!'], ['Amazing']]"
Cleveland Whiskey Cleveland The Eighty Bourbon,"Appearance / Colour
Fragrant floral, caramel, tree fruits, vanilla
Velvety, melon, toasted almonds, tart apple, oak, sherry

Clean, bright","[['All around this is a very smooth and drinkable whiskey. Flavor is not too complex, but it could still be sipped with a cube of ice without tasting like water'], ['Great example of a rice based whiskey. Light, smooth, great on the rocks.'], ['An acquired taste but a good one.'], ['Very plain to my taste, didn’t enjoy this one at all.'], ['Interesting stuff. Sweet and slightly grassy. Yummy in cocktails and interesting on its own. The flavor of the rice reminds me a little of genmaicha.'], ['I gotta rate this mid tier, more sake than whiskey but still a nice drink but probably better in a cocktail, whereas others like Takeuchi have a much better overall flavour profile.'], ['Light and very approachable.   Flavorful but elegant.'], ['Light taste very easy. Good all around'], ['Kikori has a light nd sweet initial feel followed by a briefly smokey feel and a nice whiskey finish, a great addition to any bourbon bar to break from the standard whiskey outlook.'], ['Very smooth and light, as if a Sake/Whiskey Hybrid'], ['Kikori is a fine whiskey! Light and rich at the same time (hard to imagine) this is a great drink to sip and savor slowly. It should not be mixed with anything...not even soda or ice. Lightness of taste includes a smokey and carmely quality that coats your tongue with flavor, Great Japanese whiskey.'], ['Very strong alcohol smell.  Sweet at first,  fruity at the end.'], [""Not something I'd drink as is because of the burn going down, which I feel takes away. I'd recommend a chaser if anyone is looking for smoothness going down. But it does taste good. Got a little smokey aftertaste.""], ['For a rice whisky this is amazing.  It’s light and big on taste.'], [""You say this is a whiskey but it is like a Sake! Which isn't bad just wasn't expecting this when I ordered it!""], ['Light and crisp with very little mouthfeel but a bit of burn in the back. It does have a beer note similar to bud light. I typically like my drinks more robust where with kikori i feel like im trying too hard to taste anything other than the initial taste.'], ['Like that its light and pretty smooth but not as much flavor'], ['Exceptionally clean and smooth.'], ['Too sweet!'], ['A very smooth and uniquely consistent taste from first sip to swallow.   Light and mellow.      Not what I was expecting but came to appreciate.'], ['Very much enjoyed the clean taste.'], ['Enjoyed the fresh, light taste that comes from its rice base.'], ['Very clean tasting whiskey. Lighter/ clearer taste'], [""Blah, awful, horrible, completely lacks character. Can't wait to find someone, anyone honestly that likes it so I can pass it along.""], [""Awful. Taste before you buy. That's where I screwed up.""], ['It was an extraordinary special whiskey with notes of saki due to the source of rice, but wonderful on the palate.'], ['Not whiskey, SHOCHU - very good shochu. Taste grainy and earthy, smoother slightly warmed like sake, takes away the medicinal taste.']]"
Karuizawa 12 Year Old The Colors of Four Seasons,,[]
Peach and apricot cobbler, lemon zest, and granola.
Vanilla toffee up front with tropical fruit, pepper, and lemon grass.

More tropical fruit and lingering butterscotch.","[['Had this at a local steakhouse. Was fantastic.'], [""This is a great bottle of Whiskey!  I had not seen this on Flaviar before my purchase, but received an a mazing review from a store clerk, this kid knew his stuff!  It's worth every penny!""], ['This is one of my favorite whiskies.  Very complex with a great finish.'], ['Very drinkable Japanese whiskey, but for the price, didn\'t stand out relative to Hibiki or Toki or some of the other ""light"" Japanese whiskeys.  For less money, I would keep drinking Nikka whiskeys, especially the Coffey Malt'], ['Damn good stuff, sir. I cant wait to sit next to my pool on a crisp night and enjoy this. Thats what the flavor profile brings to mind'], ['nose: butterscotch upfront, vanilla cream soda, apricots, some banana, really creamy\tpalate: thick creamy mouthfeel, vanilla and some fruit, honey and tobacco \tfinish: medium finish, vanilla lingers, still creamy, slight spice, small amount of peatoverall: really solid drink, the creamy taste and mouthfeel goes well with the fruity aspect of the drink.  easy drinker, competes well with the suntary lines'], ['Excellent! If you like scotch you will love this Japanese whiskey.'], ['Nice and interesting Japanese whisky. Complex after each sip.'], ['Very complex but in a good way!']]"

Nikka Yoichi Single Malt,,"[['Not as smooth as the yama or hibiki'], ['Smokey, vanilla, creamy. Hints of campbeltown with peat and smoke.'], ['Divine'], ['Smells like royal family'], ['Loved the smoky, wood barrel flavor that dances around the fruity and floral notes of this excellently crafted whiskey'], ['I would give this bottle a generous rating of an 8.0  I could definitely smell the peat, and there is very strong smoke presence, but there is something lacking. Sure, there is a tiny hint of candied honey and there is a slight salty flavor in the after taste, especially around the lips, but the fruitiness escapes me. If you like peat, this one may be up your alley. The finish is medium and not very complex.'], ['Loved it. Easy to drink'], ['My favorite of the Japanese whiskeys. I would have guessed this was an Islay scotch. Rich flavor of smoke, seaweed and oak. New go-to Japanese whiskey.'], ['Smokey earthy goodness with a dash of sweetness that is smooth and wonderful.'], ['Simply delicious... if you describe it, you do it a disservice.'], ['Soft,then kick. Smoky, peppery']]"
Van Brunt Stillhouse Rye Whiskey,"Color / Appearance

column2: Golden brown
Young full of herbs and oil. Some oak and smoke underneath it all.
Full of oak and corn with some cardamom, green wood and herbs in the background.

Formidable length with oak bitterness and some tasty oils countering them.","[['Really nice and smooth to sip on'], [""This one was ok but I wouldn't purchase it.  Had a pretty good burn going down and the smoke was very subtle. I didn't enjoy the first two sips but I think this whiskey gets better with some water.""], ['This one got sweeter as I drank it. The spice was pleasant and welcoming. Earthy nose with a spicy/sweet taste. Slight lingering burn, but nothing to pout about. I would buy but not for $62.'], ['Nice surprise, great nose, good neat but AWESOME on a rock!'], ['Great taste and wonderful finish'], ['Good. A good rye without the spice typical of most rye whisky. The smoke is subtle and I get stronger sugars than expected.'], ['Thought it was a great Rye! Whether you are someone wanting to get into Rye or someone that has been around the world... a great buy! First pour had strong oak flavors! After adding ice smoky characteristics came out and letting it sit for a minute a sweetness came out. Highly recommend this!'], ['I really enjoyed this, it has a lot of smokiness and spice to it. The color is awesome. If I ever get a home bar this will be on it. If you don’t like rye whiskey, it’s not for you.'], ['Way better offerings in the $60 plus range. Very heavy on the oak taste would not recommend at this price point.'], ['I enjoyed it to say the least. The oak is up front and dominant among the profile the herbal bite soon follows. All that being said, the following notes of spice, smoke, and a slightly sweet finish make this a good choice anytime.'], ['Lots of smoke and herb flavors, really enjoyed it neat with a few drops of water'], ['I was not a fan. For me, there was too much oak and smoke flavor.'], ['Strong oakey flavor that is followed favorable by some spice and sweetness. Didnt care for it when it hit my nose but after a couple sips I am a fan of this one. Just sipped it neat.'], ['Oaky and spicy with a bit of sweetness/sugar.  Loooong enjoyable finish.  Straightforward sipping rye.  A little water makes this one much more enjoyable.'], ['A bit on the peppery side, but very enjoyable'], ['Only a little flowery. I get more grain and sweet. I am a fan of this one.'], ['Strong oak taste and somewhat overpowering other flavors.'], ['Aroma: wood and slight (yet pleasant) musk/leather.  Taste: herbal spices, oak, hint of pepper.  Good warmth.  With ice: herbs prominent, no pepper spice.  Hint of oak still.\r\rOverall decent, would drink again, but might not buy outright.  Think it would work well mixed.'], ['Woody and herby with a hint of leather. Very nice drinker. This one goes to the front of my list.'], ['Clean, simple rye whiskey with light oak flavor. Easy drinking rye. Slightly spicy.'], ['A tasty rye. A little too cardboardy in the nose.'], ['Not very smooth'], ['A standout rye, with a long finish.  Lingering camel, coffee chocolate notes makes this one special. Definitely a drink Rye.'], ['Not great'], [""For a 100% rye mashbill, this is really drinkable and smooth and full of herby flavor details of the sort you get in a big gin. I pick up some cinnamon all along, but that may be eccentric. At $45 a bottle I'd buy one. At $70+, I'll pass.""], ['Did not like this one at all. Too flowery. Finish reminded me of oolong tea. Not what I’m looking for in a rye.'], [""I enjoyed the sample from one of Flaviar's kits, but upon buying a whole bottle it tasted too buttery. I suspect this is small batch and the consistency isn't quite there yet. Still good, but there are better options for the price.""], ['I’m finding that I enjoy rye quite a bit.  This one was easy to drink with a hint of sweetness.'], ['very medicinal'], ['It is a good, intense, with a bold & oily birth; while an intense life leads to a long, oily & toasty death with bitter oakiness & a hint of sugar.'], [""I'm not much of a Rye fan, but this… simply, where had this rye been all my life and I'll be having a bottle of this in my personal stash.""], ['super smooth, easy taste, but great taste'], ['Lots of wood and floral notes. Perfect amount of spice. Maybe my new favorite rye.'], ['Very tasty'], ['Aroma of fresh tobacco is beautiful and inviting.  The botanicals take it in a surprising direction.  If you like interesting botanical gins, you will probably like this rye.'], ['Interesting you should mention gin. I thought it was somehow ginny too. In a good way. A lot of those herby, woody details realy come across.'], ['Clean, nice rye nose, smooth bread pudding finish'], ['smells like dough , herbal taste.'], ['So smooth and good flavor. Really enjoyed this rye. Not sure it’s worth the price though. Tried it with my Advent Calendar.'], ['very medicinal'], [""Not too bad. These rye whiskeys are growing on me. It was a little outside my wheelhouse but it's got flavor. I wouldn't hesitate to give it a try!""], ['A little sweet with some definite spice. The nose has elements of peppermint. Pretty good, but not my fave.'], ['Strong young wood flavor.  Not my cup of tea but definitely has some stand out flavors that others might love'], ['Pretty good complex flavor profile. More Smokey and less sweet than most ryes. Probably a little expensive for what you are getting though'], ['Oaky'], ['I dig it; lots of complexity with the herbal Smokey up front flavor, the oily mouthfeel and long Spicey finish. Funky.'], ['Very herbaceous.  Too long of a finish.  A bit oily on the tongue., even a touch of terpentine.   Does not have the bite I seek in a rye.'], [""It smells like it has a strong oak taste but it tastes like it was aged in barrels of green wood. Not too bad but I wouldn't buy a bottle for myself.""], ['Not a really flavorful rye.'], ['Strong wood and smoke flavors'], ['Spicy! Very tasty'], ['I couldn’t sip this — tasted like wet leaves and bitterness. Perhaps interesting in a cocktail, but no comparison to the other selections in the tasting box.'], ['A little more sting in the aroma than I am accustomed to. Rated a 7 for the taste tho.'], ['I really wish the nose matched up with the flavor more. The herbal nose/flavor gives way to a woody & what I am assuming is the ""cardamom"" spice note that doesn\'t suit my palate well.'], ['Damn this was the favorite out of the sampler,  I will be adding this bottle to my collection. Smooth and what a great taste.'], ['I really enjoyed this Rye'], ['Nice tasting Rye. I am confused as the Flavor spiral on the app is much different than the one sent with my sample'], ['Decent'], ['If you want to taste what an oak tree in your mouth tastes like, than this is for you. Me not so much.'], ['Coriander, Pine, Cardamom and Botanicals made for a very interesting spice feel.'], ['Hated it.  If you like Gin you might like this Whiskey.'], ['Smooth finish with flowery hints.'], ['This is a really flavorful Rye. Absolutely one for the sipping room.'], ['I loved it very smooth and great taste.'], [""I get a wood-varnish nose and finish that I'm not too fond of, but it's overall decent, with an herbal spice on the palate. I agree with Peyton on the peppery finish with a hint of cardamom, but the vaporous varnish aspect keeps me from enjoying this more.""], ['Lots of herbs and cardamom in both the nose and flavor.  Excellent complex whiskey.'], ['Perfect Manhattan'], ['The flavor spiral that arrived with my sample is totally different than this one. The version on the app is much more accurate than the one I was sent with the sample pack.'], ['Honey-Caramel-Orange peel Nose.  Sharp Smokey-Woody Body, Over Powers and lingers. Pepper shows up at the end with a slight Cardamom flavor'], [""After reading reviews I've often wondered if my bottle was skunked or if I'm crazy. I found it bitter and rough. It wasn't smokey, it was burned.""], ['Nose: honey, caramel, currant, cloveFlavor: oak, phenolic, citrus, spicyThe woody dryness is so upfront and pronounced, that it nearly downs out the subtlies that exist underneath. If they could figure out a way to mellow it out just a smidge, it would be a far more complex and interesting spirit.'], [""Loved it! One of the best rye whiskies I've tasted. A very fun and flavorful sip.""], ['This excellent. Smooth and easy to drink.'], ['A very smooth and flavorful rye. I really enjoy the nose with a pleasant wood aroma. Something different.'], [""It was without question the smoothest, full body, and tastiest Rye I've tried for the value.  Highest recommendation.""]]"

column1: Hillrock Solera Aged Bourbon Whiskey,"Appearance / Color
It’s sweet on the nose with toffee, ripe fruits, and exotic florals.
The palate opens up with spice and more toffee before blooming with vanilla orchids, walnuts, cinnamon toast, and sultanas.

The finish is long and smooth with notes of butterscotch.","[['Excellent bourbon! It gives Kentucky bourbons a run for their money'], ['Super smooth. Really good neat'], ['Extremely smooth with an almost perfect flavor. I would strongly recommend this for a sipping bourbon on special occasions. Wish I could afford it for every day.'], ['very smooth finish. I visited the distillery last year Very nice folks. Also, BTW, Ancram NY is the birthplace of my maternal grandparents and where they are buried !'], ['Fantastic bottle.  Bold caramel flavor with an extremely smooth, but long and enjoyable finish.'], [""One of the best Bourbon's I've had. Right near the front of my sizable collection.""], [""Ever since I discovered Hillrock, it has been one of my favorites. This most recent order was the 3rd I've purchased. Great neat or on a rock, as others have said it's very smooth. I just wish it wasn't so expensive!""], ['Very nice! Smooth. Refined. Great depth of flavor. Love the bottle.'], [""Love it.  It's great either neat or on ice with a splash of branch water.  Really smooth finish, awesome flavors.""], [""It's an excellent bourbon. It has jumped to the top of my list for sipping and recommending to friends.""], ['Great aroma, great flavor, smooth finish'], ['Wonderful'], ['Beyond sophisticated taste. Hillrock stands toll next to Kentucky Bourbon bottles.'], ['Great Bourbon'], ['Excellent Flavor, Smooth finish'], ['tasty and complex'], ['Great length, solid sipper, butterscotch, caramel, vanilla, baking spices. One of the top bourbons on the market below $100'], ['sweet and spicey'], ['Wonderful'], ['Great taste but not worth the price.']]"
Very Olde St. Nick 18 Year Old Bourbon,,[]

column2: Smoky deep amber orange.
?Smell / Nose / Aroma
Huge but soft. Vanilla, honey, molasses, orange, tropical fruits, black banana and spice. Meaty aroma and cedar.
?Flavor / Taste / Palate
Massive and intense. Spicy, sweet - almost liqueur like and hot. Blackberry and burnt sugar. Oak, then dryness (tannin, tobacco).?
?Finish
Hot, long, spicy and intense. Almond, wood, corn, a touch of maple syrup, pepper.
?CommentWhile it is not necessary to cut the bourbon with water, a splash or two of distilled water is recommended (by Booker Noe) to unlock some of the flavour.Flavour spiral

column3: Rye, spicy, orange, oak, sweet, vanilla, black cherry, smoky, syrup.","[['first sip is hot then mellows after, long lasting taste with good oak finish.  scotch glass with some ice cubes sip with friends great stuff.'], ['The whiskey is too strong, with a powerful burning sensation as it finishes. There are notes of oak, which are quickly overpowered by the finish.'], ['Strongneeds a cube to open it up'], ['It’s good'], ['Ehh!  It’ll drink.  Good with coke.'], [""With a touch of water to open it up it's wonderful.""], ['Love it,  what heat.  Great over a big chunk of clean filtered ice.'], ['pretty harsh'], ['Dangerously smooth, given the proof. A great sipper.']]"

column2: Smoky deep amber orange.
?Smell / Nose / Aroma
Huge but soft. Vanilla, honey, molasses, orange, tropical fruits, black banana and spice. Meaty aroma and cedar.
?Flavor / Taste / Palate
Massive and intense. Spicy, sweet - almost liqueur like and hot. Blackberry and burnt sugar. Oak, then dryness (tannin, tobacco).?
?Finish
Hot, long, spicy and intense. Almond, wood, corn, a touch of maple syrup, pepper.
?CommentWhile it is not necessary to cut the bourbon with water, a splash or two of distilled water is recommended (by Booker Noe) to unlock some of the flavor.Flavor spiral

column3: Rye, spicy, orange, oak, sweet, vanilla, black cherry, smoky, syrup.","[['Is good bold flavor good with a decent cigar'], ['Smoothest bourbon I’ve ever had'], ['Ok'], ['What high proof bourbon is all about. Sweet and oaky.'], ['sweet with hints of butterscotch'], ['Strong and Sweet'], ['This one will put some hair on your ass. In the best way possible.'], ['Another one of my favorites! I find the nose a little softer than others, but it’s not without substance. Then comes the hammer! The front is quite hot, with an absolute explosion of spice and notable sweetness. Lots of caramel and vanilla. Finish is sweet corn to syrup, with the spice lingering to fruit (mostly orange).'], ['This is the perfect bourbon!   If it is too spicy add some Ice or a little water and opens up really nice.'], [""Not really a fan of this one.  It's a bit too intense for my liking.  The big spiciness isn't really my go-to for bourbon flavors...""], ['A lot of backend bite'], ['Strong bite and Smokey'], ['Smells of rich toasted sugar, initial mouthfeel is thick and astringent, warms into heavy caramel and vanilla, long finish blooming into more caramel.'], ['This is a perfect combination of spicy/punch and mellow vanilla flavor.  The longer it sits in the air, the better it tastes.  I added a few drops to open it a little and lower the initial punch.'], ['Amazing'], [""Very nice with ice or water, the flavors really come out.  Straight, it's too much.""], ['Really nice flavor,'], ['Literally burns your taste buds off... as someone who prefers to sip neat this stuff is hard to handle sometimes. There are much better examples of cask strength with better flavor and more controlled burn and finish.'], [""Harsh and high alcohol content to start, so it is one of the rare bourbons my husband actually prefers with ice instead of straight, but once you've pumped the brakes a bit it is quite delicious.""], ['This is a nice occasion sipping Bourbon, to be enjoyed over a conversation, neat.  There is nothing subtle about any aspect of this stuff.  The sweetness, accompanied by the spice & heat & complexity of its long finish, is intense. I always make sure I have a bottle in my cabinet.'], ['Not good!! Taste of camp fire like drinking a log off the fire. Very harsh to the nose and smoke infused. Did not care for this at all'], ['Smooth and rich, oaky taste'], ['Amazing creamy goodness'], [""It doesn't get any better than this.""]]"

column1: Sweet with roses, orange marmalade, and malt
Caramel, oranges, and grain stand out with a gentle hint of spice

Medium length and sweet with more zest","[['I really enjoyed the Ryemageddon but this one is horrible! Smells and tastes like turpentine! Not sure if this was a bad batch but it tastes nothing like whiskey and I love IPA’s.'], [""Perhaps I just don't like hops that much.  I'm not a big IPA fan anyway, but I figured I'd give this a shot.  The smell is interesting.  Unfortunately, it tastes like burning flower.  Such a shame, since I like everything else I've had from Corsair.""], ['Deem good'], [""I appreciated the hoppy nose, but that's about where my appreciation ended.  Taste approached musty, dirty socks.  Distill more Buck Yeah and leave the hops for the brewers.""]]"
Tons of baking spices with plenty of oak and burn, but cherry at the end.

Candy Red Hots with more oak and cherries.","[['I had a 7 rating, but upping to an 8 after months of enjoying this.  This is definitely a go-to bourbon, especially if you like a hint of cherry'], ['Live it'], ['Keep it cimejng'], ['Good one must try 4 th bottle better every time everyone agrees'], ['I love it is is a good one must tey'], ['I really enjoyed my first sips of this.  The cherry is subtle, but you can definitely taste it.  Definitely a good sipping Bourbon, but not as complex as the description would lead you to believe.  Still, definitely one to have in your cabinet.'], ['Classic bourbon flavor, very smooth'], ['Expected more based on the backstory.  Taste profile misses the complexity and balance.'], ['Good smooth mellow Smokey rich'], ['The verdict is still out on it.  I like to try different bourbons and this one is still hard to define.']]"
Mars Shinshu Iwai Tradition Whisky,"Appearance / Color
Peppery, cherry, toffee, honey, ginger spice

Long, crisp, rounded","[[""My current personal favorite whisky; it's incredibly smooth and leads with fruity floral notes on the scent, while having a complex flavor between more sweet honey and toffee flavors and the more fruity finish imparted by the port, wine, and sherry barrels used in its aging. Would highly recommend.""], ['My first time trying a Japanese Whisky. Has a good flavor and very smooth to drink. On the rocks was best for me.'], ['Super smooth, a warm, very neutral taste'], ['Smooth. Caramel.'], ['Easy drinking but uneventful'], ['Cedar and toffee aroma with a similar flavor. Easy drinking but fairly simple. Would like more complexity.'], ['My first Japanese whisky experience.  Tastes like a blended scotch with a very short, dry finish.  Some sherry sweetness.  Not a bad drink, just not my preference.  Good experience.'], ['The nose is very strong and dark, like plums, peat, and sherry. The flavor is, by contrast, quite light and fruity. There is a distinct sweetness to it, and a pleasant peat after flavor. Definitely one of my favorite drams, especially because of the stark contrast between the aroma and flavor.'], ['Just like most of the Japanese whisky, it is a very pleasant, easy scotch, a bit on the sweet side to my taste'], ['Strong aroma, caramel spice $'], ['Clean and fragrant whisky, notes of vanilla, caramel and spices with some honey. A bit strong in palate and medium long finish with oak aftertaste'], ['The Caramel, Cherry, Sherry and Honey really make for a smooth, sweet whiskey. This is a fine addition to any home bar for the whiskey initiate.'], [""This isn't a heavy whisky, it's elegant and nuanced. The Japanese really elevate blending to an art form. This product is a crazy good deal.""], [""Could be better for the price.  Nothing really stands out for me in this whiskey, kind of plain. Won't be buying this again.""], ['Good middle shelf spirit smooth but is missing something not bad for the price'], [""It had great potential but it comes off as confused as to where it's going. It's all over the board and doesn't follow a nice linear transition between flavors.""], [""It's a $30 bottle of whiskey. It's good to have around for drunk/cheap friends or to mix with Coke. You get what you pay for but, as far as $30 bottles go, it's pretty good.""], [""My first whisky. I thought it was pretty strong. Very woodsy or smokey? I can't really say""], ['Not sure yet, still have more work to do on bottle before i decide if i like it'], [""This was probably the worst whiskey I've ever tasted in my entire life. It is completely  unpalatable.  The taste is completely on describable. It's a mixture between turpentine and linseed oil.""], ['This was smooth and good\rSorry to say I drank it right away!description was unique and true'], ['Nice'], [""First Japanese whisky. A lot of unexpected floral notes makes it hard for me to compare. Don't hate it, but don't love it.""], ['Very clean, not complex but good.   Spice on the backend'], [""Not sure why it says 1.6 on the rating. Unfortunately I ordered this prior to Flaviar.  This Japanese is very different. At 80 proof this whiskey starts off very slow, not much happening at beginning, but leaves you with a great vanilla/honey hit on the palate with a small oak hit. Great start off to Japanese whiskey, try this first in your sampling and follow with a stronger Japanese whiskey and you'll gain a true appreciation for their craft. More a 6 on my scale.""]]"

Warm and smooth port finish","[[""Got this as a gift and it is a decent bottle. Can definitely taste the rum qualities. Good as a mixer if you like that. Not sure I'd buy it but wouldn't turn it down.""], ['Very smooth, worth searching for'], ['It is an outstanding, creamy, small batch double-distilled blended Whisky with a sweet birth & rich life, lead to a spicy finish.'], ['Tried this at JP Wisers distillery and it’s amazing! Very smooth with a slight spice flavor'], ['A smooth taste that was very surprising going down.'], ['I am no expert, but this was really good. Smooth, Rum undertones, sweet with a little spice. I really enjoyed this...so much that I ordered another one.'], ['This totally tastes like a much more expensive whiskey. Smooth, moderate level of sweetness, great with a little water or ice, incredible value for the price. This will not last long.'], ['Best non Isley whisky ever, had me self 4cl every night, as night cap. <3'], ['Great flavor. It is smooth and I like that it is spicy.'], ['A little too spicy for my taste.  Would not purchase for my bar.'], ['I would drink this all day if possible. Top Score, -1 star for not being a bigger bottle'], ['Solid 8. Smooth and just the right amount of sweet'], ['A whiskey full of great flavor.'], ['Very smooth! My new favorite Canadian!'], ['Very good and rather smooth. My new favorite Canadian whisky at this price point.'], ['Aged in port barrels... what are you waiting for? Simply awesome!!'], [""It's very smooth and a good addition to my bar.  My only criticism is that I received the Pike Creek finished in Rum Barrels, which is not what was listed when I purchased it.  Anyway, I still really enjoy it.""]]"

Long, strong and smoky","[['A unique smokey and spicy taste.'], ['Like it a lot. Sweet goes well with the smoke.'], ['Smooth. Again, no beer.'], ['Very peaty and smoky; reminds me of a Lavagulin or Lafroaig, but with a bit less complexity.'], ['Too smoky to be enjoyable'], [""You can smell the smoke and a bit of caramel, but there's not much depth on the palate. Lacks smoothness, and burns like chlamydia on the way down.""]]"
The New Zealand Whisky Collection 23 Year Old Cask Strength 1990 (Tasting sample),,[]

Few Rye Cask Strength Whiskey,,"[['Dark in color. Pungent in the glass. Cherry/sherry taste. Sweeter than Whistle Pig. Nice! I am ordering a bottle!'], ['good nose, a little burn on the finish'], ['Loved it!! Very smooth. No burn and very flavorable. Sweet notes'], ['Love the honey and caramel notes! Sweet, dark and smooth.'], ['Soo good'], ['Too much burn.'], ['I liked it a lot.'], ['Very nice flavor, you really get the sweetness as a secondary taste.'], ['Really liked the over all flavor. I’m not a big fan of the spice, but the over flavor was quick and pleasant. I’ll be reaching for this in the days to come.'], ['This was an OK rye, but not excellent.  This, simple flavors and a little too burny to drink neat, which is how I like my rye.'], [""I'm more of a bourbon person, but I did like this rye...nice flavour.""], [""Very smooth but almost no body. Felt like it evaporated on my tongue and wasn't terribly forward.""], ['This and a Maduro cigar is heavenly.'], ['A surprisingly mellow and flavorful rye whiskey at is great to slip on.'], ['Super-smooth. Nice hints of caramel and honey, with a little pepper mixed in.  Very enjoyable.'], ['good nose, a little burn on the finish'], ['Very tasty. My new obsession.'], ['Not a fan of this whiskey. The nose is interesting, but everything goes down hill from there. In my opinion it is very rough around the edges.'], ['Very easy to drink'], ['Not sure what people are saying about missing the sweet notes. It’s the first thing I noticed when o cracked the test bottle open. Tasted warm at first and it was smooth and spicy, with a nice sweet afternote. I prefer my whiskey with a rock or two, and this one only got better when chilled. Added to my wish list!'], ['Poor taste. Also each sip tasted different. None of with was very good. I’m sure it would be good in a mixed drink.'], ['Can’t taste any of sweet ingredients, a little rough after tase.'], ['Super smooth with really good spice kick!'], ['Great flavor. A little spice and acid on the finish.'], ['Strong and smooth.  I like it'], ['Love the complexity and the strong flavors.'], ['Absolutely delicious, very smooth with a subtly sweet honey taste though the finish doesn’t last long.'], [""One of the better ryes I've had, there are some strong flavors and it's very hot (93 proof). You can really taste the fruity notes after some of the initial bite.""], ['The only other Rye Whiskey I have had is Pendleton, which I enjoy. This one is just not for me. I received it in the welcome box. The aroma I got was a strong rye, cinnamon and brown sugar smell. The flavor was very strong on rye and honey. The rye is just too much for me.'], [""Could not taste much more than strong alcohol and pepper. Don't think I will be purchasing again.""], ['Not a fan.'], ['tasted like rubbing alcohol!']]"
Leopold Bros Maryland Style Rye,"Appearance/ Color
Vanilla, sugar, citrus, pine, cocoa, clove

Rounded with rye, vanilla, chocolate, and wood notes","[['Really not into this. Want a spicier rye.'], ['Quite unique. A very floral nose, dominated by freshly cut grass and hay. This carries through to the flavor profile too, along with hints of cinnamon, blueberry, burnt grain, and honey. It sounds strange but it really works well. Fruit and floral hang around as the aftertaste in a pleasant manner. No off-flavors or off-putting heat.'], ['You can really taste the strawberry in this.  It is a very unique flavor profile.  While this would not be an everyday type of drink, on occasion its quite delicious.'], ['Smooth and flavorful'], ['Very dry, floral rye. Makes a really flavorful and interesting old fashioned.'], ['Fantastic']]"
Jameson Bow Street 18 Year Old Batch 1,"Appearance / Color
The nose sings of wood and spice and toffee with an alcohol bite.
The palate is powerful with more toffee plus walnuts, saddle leather, vanilla, and a distant Sherry note.

The finish rounds our long with a nice balance of warm wood, more toffee, and baking spices till the end.","[['Very Smooth flavorful'], ['Amazingly smooth for a barrel proof, went down like juice. Flavors are subtle none over powering the other.'], ['Just fabulous. The Jameson 18 yr old has always been a favorite, but this iteration is even smoother, a true gem for any whiskey collection.'], ['Beautiful full flavor just like in the storage area at the Jameson Bow St. visitor center where I tasted whiskey from the barrel!'], ['Love everything about this one. Smooth, clean, and done right.'], ['Very smooth, and perfect balance'], ['Very smooth buttery and great balance of flavor'], ['This is the best Wiskey I have tasted, the taste and aftertaste was perfect\rValgeir B'], ['Loved it! Notes of charades.'], ['Good taste']]"
Rich fusion of vanilla, caramelized sugars and dark chocolate. Pepper is also present.
A delicate blend of citrus fruit burst with sensational bouquet of kiwi, melon, mango citrus fruit burst.
Long, dense, and flavorful aftertaste.","[['Ruby to start; use a big rock and it slowly turns to a deep, milky caramel color. Rich vanilla and burnt sugar.']]"
